text:
Sandie Jones (1951 – 19 September 2019) was an Irish singer. She was born in Dublin. She represented Ireland in the Eurovision Song Contest of 1972 with the song "Ceol an Ghrá" (). This was the only occasion in the history of the contest on which an Irish performer performed a song in the Irish language.
Jones died on 19 September 2019 under hospice care in the United States after a long battle with cancer at the age of 68.
